intro: Rhaphidophora australasica, commonly known as the Australian arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia and Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring dark green, heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by triangular, edible tubers resembling arrowheads. These tubers are rich in starch and have been traditionally used as a food source by Indigenous communities. Botanically, it belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence structure known as a spadix.
